Ist April, 1699.- Some hordes of Crim-Tartars penetrated in a headlong swoop to the very camp at Azow. None dared resist the unexpected peri13 fear filled the country far and wide around, and this very panic terror gave increased force and daring to the enemy. The farms depopulated, the fields desolate, the hamlets in ashes, the colonies widowed of their inhabitants, are standing monuments of irreparablc damage, and vestiges of the unheard-of cruelty that was exercised. The plundering hurricane swept along with it numbers of Officers, still more common soldiers, and an almost incredible multitude of serfs, into the harshest slavery.
